column5: Well got out on the Gog last Sunday, fished away from the crowds (thanks for the tip Brad). Typical daytime results, small perch, John did get a nice Jumbo though. Hmmm what else, oh yes we had a visit from Durham regional, friendly cops. The evening bite was great (for me) got 4 nice fish. It was a great day for my first outing of 09 John, Uncle Mike and I had a nice outing, and the fish tasted great!
how'd ya hook that one with no head?!?!?! I'll be heading out to the Bog later for the bit as the sun set's.  I hope any fish I get still have a head...

Hey -- quick question....what's the Durham Cop's take on beer on the ice?  Assuming that's what you're drinking in the pics....I love a couple cold ones while I'm out there....just not sure if it's entirely legal...liquor-out-of-residence and all that...nice fish btw!

Thankyou for the complements, the headless fish, well there is a story behind that, but its a secret. The cops were good guys because all we had was a couple of beers for after lunch and they could have been jerks and fined us (lectured us instead) drinking on the ice is fun, however is quite illegal. The one cop even ran to one of our still lines as we got a bite, you could tell he was an icefisherman (probably drinks beer on the ice too).
Nice haul !!!! perfect eater size too,....cheers
nice to see nothing came of a rediculous situation . good times ,, decent people ,, love the outcome.!!
Nice report and pics!   ... so the fish without a head had a face like Michael Jackson???
Too funny....   sounds like a perfect 1st trip out...even avoided going to jail!  Nice day, good company, fish for supper...good stuff   thanks for sharing.
Great report and pics Grog  Nice looking eyes.... you guys did pretty good for the first time out this season, congratulations and thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice to see one of your musky baits got blasted! haha  Good report looks like a decent day on the Bog, weather wise and fish wise.

Thanks again everyone, the best thing about all of is I promised my father-in-law, who is very ill and has zero appetite  (and loves walleye(who doesnt)), a good feed of fish. Needless to say he was very happy and very full after I delivered said fish, we both were.
